Docs.param: The for which a schema should be exported and used as the response schema.
The JSON serialization options to use.
An optional name of the schema. By default, this will be inferred from .
An optional description of the schema. By default, this will be inferred from .
Docs.summary: Creates a representing structured JSON data with a schema based on .
Docs.remarks: Many AI services that support structured output require that the JSON schema have a top-level 'type=object'. If is a primitive type like , , or , or if it's a type that serializes as a JSON array, attempting to use the resulting schema with such services may fail. In such cases, consider instead using a that wraps the actual type in a class or struct so that it serializes as a JSON object with the original type as a property of that object.
